content: sts rounds 17-19 k round 20 k5 k2tog k1 7 sts rounds 21-23 k round 24 k4 k2tog k1 6 sts row 25 rs set up to work as i-cord by slipping just-worked stitch onto an empty needle k5 using the same needle so you now have 6 sts on one dpn row 26-27 work even row 28 k4 k2tog 5 sts row 29-31 work even row 32 k3 k2tog 4 sts row 33-35 work even break yarn pass tail through all live stitches pass yarn through a second time and bury the end inside the tentacle repeat for seven remaining tentacles eyelids make four using us 3 / 3 25mm needles cast on 8 sts row 1 rs k row 2 ws p row 3 ssk k4 k2tog 6 sts row 4 p2tog p2 p2togtbl 4 sts cast off all stitches wings make two using us size 5 / 3 75mm needles cast on 14 sts row 1 rs k1 p1 6 times k2tog 13 sts row 2 ws k1 p1 6 times kfb 14 sts row 3 p1 k1 6 times k2tog 13 sts row 4 p1 k1 6 times kfb 14 sts row 5 k1 p1 6 times k2tog 13 sts © 2013 2014 infinite twist for personal non-commercial use only visit infinitetwist com for more patterns tutorials and knitting kits pattern feedback appreciated e-mail info@infinitetwist com row 6 k1 p1 6 times k1 row 7 k1 p1 5 times k1 k2tog 12 sts row 8 p1 k1 6 times row 9 k1 p1 5 times k2tog 11 sts row 10 k1 p1 5 times k1 row 11 k1 p1 4 times k1 k2tog 10 sts row 12 p1 k1 4 times k2tog 9 sts row 13 p1 k1 3 times p1 k2tog 8 sts row 14 ssk k1 p1 twice k2tog 6 sts row 15 k1 p1 3 times cast off all stitches knitwise weave in end finishing steam block all pieces using your iron s wool setting and figure 1 maximum steam output don t weave in the ends yet hold the iron about ½in / 1cm above the surface of your knitted pieces and project as much steam as possible at your knitted pieces if your iron produces insufficient steam you can also wet block your knitted pieces figure 2 making up short tentacles take a 10in / 25cm length of roving and divide lengthwise into 8 even sections figure 1 fold and twist as shown figure 2 to hold fibers together using a chopstick or dpns stuff the roving into each of the 8 tentacles figure 3 using a yarn needle and the ends left from joining yarn to knit each tentacle sew up the holes in between the tentacles figure 3 when holes are sewn up weave in the end of the yarn and clip any excess or simply tie in a knot and leave the ends dangling on the inside affix eyes on opposite sides of the head and fill head
